Protocol_summary_location: Fig. 10 (Page 10 of 14): schematic of static and dispersive one-step lysis/DNA extraction using MILs and direct integration into qPCR buffer; optional desorption into Tris buffer then Qubit

Page 9 of 14, Discussion: describes static method (hydrophobic solvent pipetted onto tissue; incubation) and dispersive method (MIL dispersed in plant suspension; rapid lysis; DNA desorption into Tris buffer at elevated temperature or directly into qPCR assay); notes compatibility with sequencing/Qubit when desorbed into Tris buffer

Pages 7–9 of 14, Results/Figs. 5–9: DNA-enriched MIL/IL integrated into qPCR buffer without inhibiting reaction; standard curves; multiple plant tissues integrated into one-pot qPCR; comparison to commercial one-pot PCR

Flag_rationales.Wash_free: Across the described MIL/IL lysis/extraction schematics and discussion (Fig. 10; Page 9), no wash/rinse steps are described as part of sample prep/lysis.
Flag_rationales.Centrifugation_free: No centrifugation/spin steps are described in the schematic/discussion for MIL/IL-based lysis/extraction (Fig. 10; Page 9).
Flag_rationales.Heat_free: Heat is explicitly used/mentioned in the approach (e.g., discussion mentions thermal desorption at 90 °C; also comparison notes heating/drying can improve recovery; Page 9).

protocols.Paper_title: Simple and efficient isolation of plant genomic DNA using magnetic ionic liquids

Protocol_summary_location: Pages 7–9 of 14 (Results/Discussion): describes direct integration of plant tissue plus MIL/IL into qPCR buffer enabling one-pot qPCR; notes amplification achieved and quantification performed
Page 11 of 14: states amplification efficiency for A. thaliana tissue coated with MIL and reacted in qPCR mix that includes 0.05% Tween20; describes real-time quantitative detection compatibility
Page 12 of 14, 'qPCR assays and conditions': describes one-pot PCR/qPCR reaction formulations containing MIL/IL and includes 0.05% Tween20 in the one-pot assays

Flag_rationales.Wash_free: One-pot integration into qPCR is described without any wash steps (Pages 7–9; Page 12).
Flag_rationales.Centrifugation_free: No centrifugation described for the one-pot qPCR integration method on these pages.
Flag_rationales.Heat_free: Thermal cycling includes high-temperature steps and discussion includes elevated-temperature desorption; exceeds 40 °C (Pages 9 and 12).

Provenance.Detergent_rationale: Tween 20 is explicitly included in the one-pot qPCR reaction mix while using MIL/IL to lyse plant tissue (Page 11; Page 12).
